org.logl.jul

Class JULLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logl.jul.JULLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger

    public final class JULLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements Logger
    An implementation of a Logger that delegates logging to a java.util.logging.Logger.

      • batch

        public void batch(java.util.function.Consumer<Logger> fn)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Write a set of log messages in a batch.

        The specified Consumer will be invoked with a Logger that collects all log output and then writes them all consecutively when the consumer invocation returns. Use this when a set of log lines must appear consecutively in the log, regardless of time ordering.

        Note: most implementations do not guarantee log ordering, so log lines may not always be ordered correctly by timestamp. This is especially true when logs are written in batch.

        Specified by:
        batch in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        fn - A Consumer that will be invoked with the batching Logger.
